meanings.definition: Not having the outer skin removed.
meanings.sent1: The unpeeled apple still had its skin on.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to eat unpeeled fruits for extra fiber.
meanings.sent3: The unpeeled potato rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: His unpeeled emotions were raw and exposed for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The unpeeled banana looked vibrant and fresh.

meanings.definition: Not having the skin or rind removed.
meanings.sent1: The unpeeled orange had a strong citrus scent.
meanings.sent2: They enjoyed the unpeeled shrimp with the shell intact.
meanings.sent3: The unpeeled lemon slipped out of her hand and into the pitcher.
meanings.sent4: Her unpeeled thoughts were complex and layered like an onion.
meanings.sent5: The unpeeled avocado felt firm and unyielding.

meanings.definition: Not having the outer layer removed.
meanings.sent1: The unpeeled onion made her eyes water.
meanings.sent2: He found the unpeeled hazelnuts to be more flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The unpeeled coconut rolled down the hill and into the pond.
meanings.sent4: Her unpeeled identity was a mystery waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The unpeeled tree bark felt rough and natural.
